CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 23, 1957, pg. 2, reads: "Plight of Large Families in Sharp Focus At Zoning Hearing on North Side Dwellings - At Zone Hearing - Mrs. Paul J. Stephens top, far left, one of the many neighbors and business people who came to the hearing on Mr. and Mrs. John Hladcyz' houses, complains: 'Why the place looks like a cyclone hit it, windows are broken out all over the place and are not being fixed up!'  Mr. Hladcyz (hands on hip behind wife) and Mrs. Hladcyz, with worried look, watch their attorney for help, as board stenographer Gertrude Evans takes notes and Zoning Board Chairman Martin Mihm presides. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Mrs. Paul J. Stephens at zoning hearing against landlords Mrs. and Mr. John Hladcyz, with Zoning Board Chairman Martin Mihm and stenographer Gertude Evans
